frame.name: Experiencer_obj
frame.definition:
<def-root>Some phenomenon (the <fen>Stimulus</fen>) provokes a particular emotion in an <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Stimulus">Nightmare on Elm Street</fex> <t>scared</t> <fex name="Experiencer">me</fex> <fex name="Result">silly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> reacts emotionally or psychologically to the <fen>Stimulus</fen>. <ex><fex name="Stimulus">Horror films</fex> <t>terrify</t> <fex name="Experiencer">Edna</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Stimulus
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the event or entity which brings about the emotional or psychological state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Stimulus">The news</fex> <fex name="Degree">greatly</fex><t>alarms</t> <fex name="Experiencer">all the women of the village</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> brings about an emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies a phrase which describes a state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the circumstances under which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> brings about the experience. <ex><fex name="Stimulus">Soft music</fex> <t>calms</t> <fex name="Experiencer">the children</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">when they're wound-up</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason why the <fen>Stimulus</fen> causes the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: aggrieve.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to feel distress or affliction; offend

lexUnit.name: anger.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to provoke a feeling of great annoyance

lexUnit.name: astound.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: overwhelm with surprise and wonder

lexUnit.name: bewitch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: captivate or entrance, as if by magic

lexUnit.name: calm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become tranquil and quiet.

lexUnit.name: captivate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attract and hold the interest and attention of; charm.

lexUnit.name: charm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: impress with one's personal attractiveness

lexUnit.name: comfort.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel less unhappy; console.

lexUnit.name: confuse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to become bewildered or perplexed.

lexUnit.name: dazzle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: overwhelm with an impressive quality.

lexUnit.name: depress.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel utterly dispirited or dejected.

lexUnit.name: disappoint.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to fulfil the hopes or expectations of.

lexUnit.name: discourage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause a loss of confidence or enthusiasm in

lexUnit.name: dishearten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to lose determination or confidence.

lexUnit.name: embarrass.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel awkward, self-conscious, or ashamed.

lexUnit.name: entertain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: provide with amusement or enjoyment.

lexUnit.name: enthrall.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: capture the fascinated attention of

lexUnit.name: excite.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause strong feelings of enthusiasm and eagerness in

lexUnit.name: fascinate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: irresistibly attract the interest of.

lexUnit.name: frustrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel dissatisfied or unfulfilled.

lexUnit.name: hearten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make more cheerful or confident.

lexUnit.name: humiliate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: injure the dignity and self-respect of.

lexUnit.name: impress.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (someone) feel admiration and respect.

lexUnit.name: mollify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: appease the anger or anxiety of.

lexUnit.name: pacify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: quell the anger or agitation of.

lexUnit.name: please.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel happy and satisfied.

lexUnit.name: puzzle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confuse because difficult to understand.

lexUnit.name: rattle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel nervous, worried, or irritated.

lexUnit.name: reassure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: allay the doubts and fears of.

lexUnit.name: satisfy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: meet the expectations, needs, or desires of.

lexUnit.name: scare.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause great fear or nervousness in; frighten.

lexUnit.name: shock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset

lexUnit.name: startle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel sudden shock or alarm.

lexUnit.name: thrill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have or cause to have a thrill.

lexUnit.name: unnerve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deprive of courage or confidence.

lexUnit.name: unsettle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to be anxious or uneasy; disturb.

lexUnit.name: upset.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make unhappy, disappointed, or worried.

lexUnit.name: bore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel weary and uninterested by being dull and tedious

lexUnit.name: vex.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel annoyed or worried

lexUnit.name: vexation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of harassing or vexing or the state of being vexed

lexUnit.name: shocker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing that shocks, especially through being unacceptable or sensational.

lexUnit.name: sicken.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause revulsion, make disgusted or appalled

lexUnit.name: tickle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be appealing or amusing to

lexUnit.name: trouble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause distress, pain, or inconvenience to

lexUnit.name: abash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel embarrassed, disconcerted, or ashamed.

lexUnit.name: exhilarate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel very happy or animated.

lexUnit.name: mortify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel embarrassed, ashamed, or humiliated.

lexUnit.name: repel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be repulsive or distasteful to.

lexUnit.name: traumatize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause a deeply distressing experience.

lexUnit.name: interest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: excite the curiosity or attention of.

lexUnit.name: intrigue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arouse the curiosity or interest of.

lexUnit.name: offend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel hurt or resentful.

lexUnit.name: surprise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an unexpected or astonishing thing.

lexUnit.name: trouble.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of being disturbed

lexUnit.name: devastate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause someone to have overwhelming grief.

lexUnit.name: worry.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to feel nervous, scared, or doubtful about something in the future

lexUnit.name: wound.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause emotional pain or damage.

lexUnit.name: kill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel unsatified or unhappy
